title: Federico Fellini: Iconically Italian
sub_head: A new collection of the auteurâ€™s films from Criterion celebrates the humor, compassion and style that make his work unforgettable.
body: When it comes to Italian filmmakers, the moralists have Roberto Rossellini; the sentimentalists, Vittorio De Sica; the aesthetes, Luchino Visconti; and the intellectuals, Michelangelo Antonioni. But for everyone else, there is Federico Fellini. And even those who swear by these others cherish deeply at least one Fellini picture. For he is...
